page.title: 14THE PARISH COUNCIL G STARR
page.content: The parish council consists of seven members representing the 190 electors and is elected every 4 years. It is unusual for there to be more than seven nominations for the seven vacancies, and so parish elections are raely necessary. As the cost of such elections has to be born by the parish, the holding of an election is not welcomed by the electors. Meetings are held as business requires and average 4 or 5 a year. Business dealt with has included obtaining grants for the improvement of the parish hall and for additional equipment in the childrens playground. All planning applications for development in the parish are considered by the council whose aim has been to maintain the rural character and natural beauty of the area while at the same time providing additional amenities.
